Wenn man Spaß daran hat als Killer getbagged geloopt und getrollt zu werden und als Solo Überlebender nur  von den eigenen Teammates behindert zu werden dann hat man bei diesem Spiel die richtige Wahl getroffen. Oder man möchte einfach nur gut aussehen weil das beste an diesem Spiel sind die Outfits. Wer dieses Spiel kaufen möchte weil er Killer spielen möchte sollte viel Zeit, Geduld und Nerven mitbringen. In den letzten Monaten sind die Killer geschwächt wurden so das man bestimmte Killer nicht mehr spielen kann. Es sei den man hat 1000+ Stunden ansonst fliegen einem die Generatoren um die Ohren und man sieht die Überlebenden beim rauslaufen und Tbaggen.

Слоган этой игры - "Баланса нет но вы держитесь". Тролли, кемперы, фармы, все эти виды "чмошников" присутствуют в игре. Так почему же я её порекомендовал ? Да потому что концепция её очень интересная и увлекательная : 4 беспомощных выживших в одном загоне с маньяком должны починить 5 генераторов, а задача маньяка не дать им это сделать и принести всех в жертву. Рекомендую играть даже при присутствии маньяков : доктора, Майкла Майерса, свинки, они. Удачи !

TL:DR: DO NOT waste your money on this game. Devs leave glaring issues in game on purpose, and call them "features". You'll find mediocre entertainment occasionally, but that's only if you're drunk, or high.

Before you wonder how a person with 1k hours, and 'red ranks', can call the game "bad", let me explain.

I've played this game for a while, simply because it was a game with quick matches, and long queue times (when playing survivor), and allowed me to do work between rounds. After playing this game for *this* long, there are a lot of things I had to learn to look past MANY OF THE GLARING ISSUES in order to find something resembling "entertainment".

This game is one of the most easily exploitable games I have ever played: Due to poor design (and frankly, the apathy of the developers), many players are able to completely undermine the regular 'intended' gameplay. What does this mean? It means that entire rounds of this game are subject to the whim of four other individuals. Now, this wouldn't be a problem if ranks, or reporting worked in segmenting certain populations of the playerbase (the drunks, trolls, high players, etc), but it doesn't No matter who you are, you're getting thrown into whatever group of people this game wants you to be with. Whoever runs the community on DBD clearly doesn't look at report messages, or follow up on toxic player reports.

As a survivor, you'll have your playing experience ruined about 20-30% of the time (THATS 1 in 5 GAMES), due poor server maintainance (player rubberbanding), other survivors griefing/ letting you die, or a killer who will face-camp you.

As a killer, you'll have your playing experience ruined by people running what are called "Survive with Friends", which tilts the odds in favor of the survivors essentially being in a voice call, and all coordinating to ruin your day. This is another regular thing, and there is no option to turn it off, or exclude yourself from Survive With Friends queues

There's certain issues the developers cannot solve (the voice chats outside of Dead by Daylight with Survive with Friends, for one), but many other problems can be solved ('hook camping' within 15m can not reduce hook time)  -- however, they either don't care, or don't think these are issues, which THEY THEMSELVES have admitted on on video that hook camping is a "feature".

One of the other things you'll find is that there is only 1 meta. In games like these, you'll usually see many characters, strategies, and ways of playing. The developers do not think it is worth their time to change any of the currently existing perks or abilities at all for some odd reason. Normally in games like this, you'd want to be changing the perks every 'season' to keep things fresh... they don't.

And even worse -- instead of fixing issues, they ADD PERKS/NEW CHARACTERS in order to 'bandaid' an issue. Example: 'Tired of getting killed THE EXACT SECOND you get pulled off the hook? Here is an ability that will allow you to not get picked up by the killer for 1 minute after getting downed!' (Only works if your team actually picks you up!)

This is seriously a backwards way of thinking about fixing problems.

Again, the developers DO NOT care to change this game. I've been playing for more than a year now, and nothing has changed to fix these problems.

Please buy a different game.

END OF REVIEW.

---- ---- ---- ---- ---- ---- ---- 

EDIT:

**** *** 

Going to leave this here just to explain to everyone the reasoning behind this review, this comment below actually gives a lot to reply to that could be expected in the future, hence why i'm taking the time to reply in full detail.

*** *** *** *** 


"The survivors are the ones trying to escape, the killers are the ones trying to make sure that the survivors don't escape by DEFENDING the thing that would allow them to do so. It's perfectly normal." -Twosoup


Aren't generators the focus of what you're defending? Not hooked survivors? If the game is about defending hooks, why do they even make chasing a thing? Why would chasing even exist, where is the reward structure for chasing? Why would generators exist? Chasing, and getting new survivors to a hook is at the core of the game, not "defending" a single survivor you hooked (MAYBE you could say that end game collapse that this makes sense, considering generators are complete, but otherwise, what???), it's only accidental that you might get any kills from it (High altruism players being punished by trying to unhook).

You even later go on as much to say "-- more long chases where you feel like you're evading the killer's every movement as a survivor, and no more feeling of urgency to protect all that you have as a killer." What long chases? There's no long chases in a hook camping match, The CHASE is a huge core of what makes this game, not defending a hooked survivor.

"The only way to fix this is to change the core gameplay to make the game end after a certain amount of time," -Twosoup

This 'only way to fix' thing seems like you're just finding a way to either defend your own position by weakening what was said above, or worse, avoid the actual solution written above and find the worst way to go about 'fixing' it to belittle what is being said above. You can easily fix this by making hook time not reduce while the killer is within 5-15 meters of a hooked survivor. This WOULD in fact be the some volatile change to this game in a while (Since the devs dont change the meta, or anything for that matter anyway, lol), but only for hook campers.

''treating people who leave you to die when you're impossible to save or people who play with their friends as your main problem with this game truly shows how little you actually understand (or cared enough to understand) about the dynamic of this game before writing this review.'' -Twosoup

That is my problem, this game DOESN'T have any dynamic gameplay. Idk how you can call a game like this dynamic when the meta is legitimately the same 3 or 4 perks, which are only meta because if you DON'T have them, you're going to be fucked over. 

Three of the most used perks in the game by survivors, and their main reasons for existing:

Borrowed time: Stop hook camping
Decisive strike: Stop hook camping
Unbreakable: Pair with DS to stop hook camping better

You know what a market bubble is? This is sort of like a "perk bubble", it exists to deal with a problem that exists within the game, and the problem is so prevalent, that nearly all survivors will have one of these perks, and 99% of games will have at least 2 or 3 of them existing simultaneously to attempt to deal with the problem. The problem is SO bad in fact, that killers will adapt their playstyle to work around some of these perks, because they know these perks exist on so much of the survivor playerbase.

I get it, this game isn't meant to be played to this serious of a level, it's really a game meant for people who are high, or drunk, it doesn't need to be this deep. But I think if the devs actually care, they could have an interesting meta, changing perks in subtle ways each 'season' to let people experiment with perks they never tried before, and get that dynamic gameplay that this game could actually have.

Este jogo se assemelha mais com uma dependência química e relacionamento abusivo do que com um jogo de terror.
Raramente faço análises no Steam, mas dessa vez me senti obrigado a deixar um aviso para todos aqueles que estão pensando em comprar o jogo.

[h1]Introdução[/h1]
Comecei a jogar atraído pela atmosfera de "terror", onde eu poderia jogar com aqueles Serial Killers dos meus filmes e franquias favoritos, ou então simular como seria ser caçado por eles.
Nas primeiras partidas, o jogo aparentava ser exatamente isso. E é aí que somos fisgados pela propaganda enganosa do game.

[h1]Matchmaking[/h1]
Logo nas partidas iniciais, você irá experimentar uma sequência ABSURDA de derrotas, o que não é nenhuma surpresa considerando que é o seu começo em um novo multiplayer. Mas após algumas partidas você começa a se perguntar: "por que é que estou jogando contra pessoas 20 níveis acima do meu?"

Este é um dos maiores problemas do jogo: [b]o pior sistema de matchmaking que há.[/b]
Não acredita em mim? Abra o YouTube e procure vídeos com "dbd matchmaking" ou "dead by daylight matchmaking" e veja por si próprio.... jogadores com 5000 horas de jogo sendo colocados contra jogadores com menos de 10 horas... o que nos leva ao próximo problema deste jogo.

[h1]Comunidade [b]extremamente[/b] tóxica[/h1]
Dificilmente você irá jogar algo online onde não haja qualquer tipo de toxicidade em alguns jogadores. Isso também é esperado, uma vez que não dá pra controlar o comportamento de quem está do outro lado.
O problema aqui é que o jogo em si INCENTIVA esta toxicidade dos jogadores. Devido ao desbalanceamento entre Killers vs. Survivors (incluindo aqui o Matchmaking quebrado), muitas vezes os jogadores são obrigados a recorrerem á praticas consideradas "anti jogo" pra tentar compensar as falhas do jogo. Isso vai desde Killers "campando" jogadores pra tentar garantir pelo menos 1 pontinho na partida, até Survivors que abusam do famigerado "teabagging" quando vêem que estão jogando melhor que o killer.

[h1]Bugs pra todos os lados[/h1]
Os dois pontos acimas são até que comuns em todos os jogos online (apesar de serem dominantes em Dead by Daylight), então provavelmente isso não será o suficiente pra te espantar do jogo. Mas mesmo que você insista em treinar, se esforçar pra jogar cada vez melhor, os desenvolvedores ainda tem mais um tapa pra dar na sua cara. A cada bug que é corrigido, 5 novos são criados. A começar da otimização do jogo que é péssima (sua GPU vai sofrer pra jogar um game com limite de 60 FPS, não importa qual a capacidade dela), muitos bugs realmente afetam a jogabilidade. Mais uma vez eu poderia citar vários deles, mas o YouTube continua aí. É só procurar "dead by daylight bugs" e se perguntar como um jogo desse sequer foi lançado.

[h1]Resumo[/h1]
Não gaste seu tempo com esse jogo. É puro stress, e você ainda paga por isso.

Over 50k players on Steam today, that's not counting the crossplay and other PC stores that play with you. Matchmaking still takes 5+ minutes sometimes whether you're solo survivor or with a group. With the killer role, it varies, but still can take awhile.

If you can sit through matchmaking for grinding, sure it's an alright game. The real magic is when you play with 5 people in customs

This is one of my favourite games ever, unfortunately in this games current state I can't recommend buying it, hackers running wild at higher MMR thanks to it being given away for free on Epic, as well as a blatantly biased balancing system favouring survivors to sell cosmetics, the games art direction is superb and sound design is mostly good, but it's the balancing, and blatant disregard for their own player base that really disappoints.
Bit buggy, but great fun - recommend for horror movie fans

Bem eu jogo o jogo a bastante tempo, desde o começo do game, e uma coisa que me deixa muito triste é que os desenvolvedores não otimizam o game. O jogo tem um intuito muito bom, mas enquanto os desenvolvedores não pararem de gastar o tempo criando skin ou ate mesmo killer ou sobrevivente vai demorar pro jogo ficar bom, pois o jogo já tem bastante killer e sobrevivente e outra, a questão de otimização vai trazer ainda mais pessoas para o jogo.

As someone who has played the game extensively, I can safely say DO NOT BUY. The devs are a bunch of money hungry, bloodsucking ghouls who will try to shaft you at every opportunity. I was recently wrongfully banned for "cheating", even though I have never even cheated and don't even know how to. They won't help me, and god knows they wouldn't help any of their players. Don't feed them your time and money because BHVR is the goddamn antichrist. That is all.

Oyun bir katil ve 4 kurbandan oluşuyor . Temel amaç çıkış kapılarına güç vermek için 5 jeneratör tamir etmek . Jeneratörlerin tamiri uzun sürüyor , diğer kurbanlarla daha hızlı tamir ediliyor .Ayrıca jeneratör tamiri esnasında , önce ses uyarısı ardından beceri denemesi geliyor . Eğer beceri denemesini beceremezseniz jeneratör patlıyor, tamir süresi uzuyor ve katile bildirim gidiyor . Sizin peşinize düşüyor . Onun dışında katilden kaçmak için palet, fener , ve bazı yetenekler bulunuyor . Katili olabildiğince oyalarsanız takım arkadaşlarınız jeneratörleri rahatlıkla bitirir . Oyuna ilk başladığım zamanlarda daha çok saklanarak oynardım şimdi katili peşime takıp onunla vakit geçirmek daha zevkli oluyor . :) Arkadaşlarınızla girerseniz daha kordineli ,daha zevkli oluyor . Fiyatını hakediyor ...

       Rahat 2000 saat ...
